intro: Primula melanops, commonly known as the black primrose, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is characterized by its striking dark purple to almost black flowers, which contrast with its bright green, ovate leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of about 10–20 centimeters and thrives in cool, moist environments. It is a perennial species that produces showy blooms in late spring to early summer. The flowers are tubular and attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
